content: I don't have personal preferences, but i suggest you visit the national museum of anthropology first. it is an excellent starting point as it provides a comprehensive overview of mexico's indigenous cultures. the museum has vast collections of cultural artifacts that offer visitors an in-depth look at mexico's pre-columbian past. it also has several exhibits, including the famous aztec calendar stone, the giant olmec heads, and many more. the museum is easy to reach, and there are audio guides available in different languages to help visitors navigate through the exhibitions.
